runs.comm: length ball outside off, shapes away and beats Masakadza's defensive bat. To be fair to the batsman, he may have played inside the line deliberately and left it alone
full outside off, driven to mid-off
bouncer now and Masakadza sways away from it
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
short and wide, and Chibhabha is beaten by a bit of outswing as he leans back to cut
length ball on middle stump, and it bounces sharply to square up Masakadza, hits him high on the bat, on the sticker, and he nearly pops it back to the bowler
full on leg stump and that is whipped over midwicket but there's a man back at deep square leg to run across and mop up
back of a length on off stump, whipped to mid-on
short, sits up, pulled away to the left of deep square leg
back of a length on middle and off, no room, punched into the covers
down the track, gets inside the line of the length ball to make himself extra width, and slaps it high over extra cover
short, angling into the body, hits him on the stomach as he goes back to pull
wow. That is birthday bashed down the ground. It was fullish, angling into middle stump, and he cleared his front leg and clumped it through the line, hitting hard over mid-on

short and wide, and that's bye, bye, birthday boy. Maybe some extra bounce, but he was moving away from the line to make room, ended up having to reach for the ball to cut it, with his weight going backwards, and could only get a top edge through to the keeper

and he's dropped first ball! That was the perfect ball, slanting away on a good length, and he pushed at it, away from his body, and edged it thickly. Ronchi, diving to his left, got both gloves to it at a comfortable height, and made an utter mess of it
short outside off, punched towards point
bouncer, Ervine ducks under it

and he strikes first ball. Length ball, angling into middle stump. It's the old-fashioned stump-to-stump military medium that New Zealand have long excelled at, and Chibhabha plays a poor shot, slogging across the line. You miss, I hit. Chamu miss, Jimmy hit.
full outside off, driven towards short cover
length ball outside off, driven to cover point. New Zealand have a packed ring of fielders on the off side
back of a length outside off, straightens a touch and beats Raza's edge as he tries to force it away with an angled bat
short on off stump, and Raza doesn't quite get hold of the pull, but hits it well enough and puts it in an unguarded area, high towards wide long-on
full outside off and that is hit crisply and fielded even better. Short cover dives to his left to cut off a drive that looked destined for the boundary
back of a length, wide, cut away backward of point, to the left of the third man fielder. Sodhi dives to cut off the boundary
back of a length again, closer to off stump, punched to point
length ball outside off and Ervine goes for the drive without moving his feet. Finds the edge of his angled bat but doesn't carry to the keeper

bouncer, and Ervine is hit again. McClenaghan smacked his helmet twice in the second ODI, and this time it's Milne's turn. Goes into an uncomfortable semi-crouch, eyes off the ball, and the ball hits the back of his helmet and pings away towards fine leg
back of a length on off stump, blocked to short cover
short ball, angling into the batsman, and Raza gets down low and sways his upper body out of the way. This is hostile stuff from Milne
full on off stump, Ervine plays a checked drive to mid-on
back of a length on middle and leg, poked back to the bowler. Was looking to work it leg side, but the ball was angling away and he had to check himself
shortish, down the leg side, Raza moves his hip away from the line and allows it through for the wide
full outside off, slower ball, goes for the drive and edges it, gets it into the gap to the left of Munro at short third man. He dived to his left, but couldn't get to the ball with one hand
that's quicker, back of a length, and Raza, looking to dab it into that third man region again, only manages to feather it through to the keeper
length ball angling across, left alone, and it's wide enough for the umpire to signal wide

back of a length on off stump, dabbed softly into the cover region for the quick single. Nathan McCullum sprinted in hard and flicked it underarm towards the stumps at the keeper's end. Ervine would have been out had he hit the stumps
shortish outside off, slashed in the air, wide of backward point
down the track, nowhere near the pitch of this off-stump ball, stretches out to work it into the leg side
down the track, and this time Raza doesn't get to the pitch. Turns in sharply, hits him on the front pad, as he looks to work it from outside off
short ball on off stump, flat-batted down the ground to long-on
length ball outside off, slapped down the ground to long-off
shortish outside off, chopped away into the cover point region
short, angling into the body, turns in and spins down the leg side as Chigumbura misses the pull

fuller, on off stump, and Chigumbura clears his front leg, heaves at it, and holes out to long-on. It was bowled fairly quick, and Chigumbura didn't quite middle it, ended up hitting it near the bottom of the bat
tossed up on middle and leg, driven down to long-on
length ball outside off, Ervine stretches out to block it back to the bowler
length ball on middle stump, swept straight to short fine leg
full on leg stump, clipped away to deep backward square leg
length ball, and Williams unwisely goes on the back foot. Turns in sharply, hurries into him, and smacks him on the thigh pad
short now, pulled from an off-stump line, and long-on runs hard to his left and dives to stop the boundary
fullish on middle and off, presses forward and tucks it into the square leg region
back of a length on off stump, makes room and slaps it to deep point
stays back to a length ball on off stump, makes a bit of room to force it away towards sweeper cover
shortish on off stump, flat-batted down the ground, towards long-on
down the track, gets inside the line, drives inside-out to long-off
short and wide, swatted away to the left of sweeper cover
flighted on middle and leg, chipped over the bowler's head, down towards long-on
nice change of pace, dangles it slow and wide of off stump, has to reach out a long way to sweep, misses
fuller now, on off and middle, clipped towards midwicket

dropped. It's floated up full on middle stump, driven hard, in the air, back to the bowler, who gets both hands up to shoulder height but can't hold on. Ball hits his fingertips and ricochets into the off side. Looks like he's hurt one of the fingers of his right hand. Ring finger, I think. That's his spinning finger. The physio has come out to tape it up.
tossed up on middle stump, clipped away to the left of midwicket
nice flight on leg stump, dips on Williams as he stretches out to defend, straightens and squeezes past his inside edge and hits him on the pad
length ball on middle and off, goes on the back foot to work it away through square leg
flat and quick, full on leg stump, clipped down the ground to long-on
sees him coming down the track and attacks him with a full ball on his pads. Can't put bat to it
full, almost in the blockhole, and wide outside off, can only jab it into the off side
shortish on off stump, and that is nicely done by Ervine, just a short-arm jab with a roll of his wrists on top of the bounce and he finds the gap between long-on and deep midwicket
shortish outside off, slapped away towards sweeper cover
shortish on middle and off, pulled to deep midwicket
down the track and Sodhi slows it down, shortens the length outside off, and he can only stretch out to pad it
low full-toss outside leg, swept away down to long leg
down the track, gets inside the line of the full-toss, and that is excellent placement, scoops it over the bowler's head and bisects long-on and long-off

down the track again, meets it on the full again, but this time he doesn't get the elevation, smashes it hard towards the umpire, and Sodhi stretches his right arm out and completes a superb one-handed grab
length ball on middle and off, goes on the back foot to defend back down the ground
down the track, gets too close to the pitch of the ball, jabs it back down the ground
short outside off, chopped away towards deep point
sharp turn from outside off as he goes on the back foot, making room to hit through the off side, can only punch down the ground to long-on
full on off stump, clipped away through square leg
shortish on middle stump, pulled to deep midwicket
tossed up on off stump, goes for the reverse sweep, can't beat backward point. The idea was sound, since both point and third man were in the circle
slower ball on middle and leg, blocked back to the bowler
sees him coming out of his crease and sends down the short ball, angling into the body. Chakabva sways out of the line
slower ball, full, ends up sliding it a long way down the leg side
slower ball on off stump, driven down to long-on
slower ball outside off, Ervine stretches out and pushes it softly into the covers
full, angling in too far, slides down leg once again
slower ball outside off, back of a length, lets it come on and dabs it to third man
another slower ball, angled across Ervine, who misreads the length entirely while stretching across for a lap-sweep, and the ball ends up bouncing over his helmet
back of a length outside off, dabbed away towards third man
full and wide, and that is nicely done by Ervine, makes a little more room and stabs it away to the extra cover boundary
short outside off, pulled to deep square leg
short and wide, Chakabva cuts straight to backward point
short and wide again, and this time it sits up nicely, gives Chakabva ample time to pick his spot, and he slaps it high over the covers
fuller now, angling into off stump, tucked away quietly towards mid-on
legbreak tossed up outside off, stays on the back foot and uses his wrists to work it to long-on
short, slanting away from the batsman, pulled firmly but straight to midwicket

missed stumping there. Comes down the track and he follows him with a quicker ball, bowls a full-toss that squirts between the batsman's legs as he looks to flick, and the unsighted keeper misses the ball too
shapes for the sweep too early, and the ball is a touch short for that shot, and he ends up bottom-edging it into the leg side
goes for another sweep from outside off, and this time it turns and bounces to beat his outside edge
sees him coming and bowls it short, pulls it down to long-on

back of a length, angling into off stump, and that's nicely done by Chakabva, who lets it come on, leans away from the line, and dabs it fine to the left of third man, who has to put in the dive to stop it at the boundary. McClenaghan, the fielder. Looks like he pushed it away with his left hand before his body dragged over the line. Hard to tell from the camera angles provided

short, angling into the body, and Chakabva tries the same shot again, leaning away to dab/ramp it towards third man. Was too cramped for room to do that, and he ended up popping it in the air, off the glove, behind the wicket, and Ronchi swooped forward to take the low catch
fast and full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
short, doesn't climb as much as Cremer expected, scooted under his attempted pull
short again, angling sharply into the batsman and beating his inside edge as he jabs at the ball, feet well inside the line
full and wide and Ervine lofts it in the air, over the covers, and McCullum sprints to his right from long-off, gets a hand to it on the dive, but can only deflect it into the rope
full on middle and leg, jabbed firmly in the air, one bounce to long-on
yorker on off and middle, clipped away into the vacant midwicket region
another yorker, on middle stump, clipped down the ground to long-on
slower ball on the pads, tucked away to deep square leg
in the blockhole on middle and off, makes a bit of room and slices it in the air, wide of the diving cover fielder

banged in short, goes for the pull from over his right shoulder, and spooned it in the air to the right of midwicket, and that;s a super catch from Neesham, diving to his right and catching it low with one hand
tests Ervine with the bouncer, and he ducks low under it
short on off stump, pulled away to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, jabbed away towards backward point
slower bouncer outside off, Ervine can't put bat to ball as he swivels into a pull
short, follows the batsman as he moves away from leg stump, and Ervine swivels to smack a pull over the backward square leg boundary
slower ball on off stump, pulled towards long-on
looks to make swinging room and launch one down the ground, can't connect with the slower ball outside off
another slower ball, straighter this time, and it takes out off stump as Ervine slogs all around it
slower ball, full outside off, and Mpofu pokes at it, playing down the wrong line entirely. Ball beats his outside edge, beats the keeper, and runs away for four byes
slower ball wide of off stump, Mpofu swings and misses
short ball to finish, gets up to waist height, and Mpofu opens up at the hips and pulls it over the backward square leg boundary
